author: StarfishandSeashells
title: Perfect
text:
This is now one of my favorite hotels in the City.
It is just steps away from Penn Station, which is great if you are arriving by Amtrak or using LIRR to connect to Air Train to JFK.
The front desk staff was friendly and our room was ready early, which is rare in NYC. The hotel was trendy and clean. There were three elevators and a visual to let you know the location of each.The lobby had ample seating and extra outlets built into a box.
The room was great with Marriott beds. Our view was of the New Yorker building. We were high enough up to not have street noise.
There was complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful with many choices. It was the largest breakfast area I have seen, with plenty of seating and food and drink areas spread out for better flow. There was also an outdoor eating space (covered in snow during our visit). We didn't visit the rooftop lounge due to the weather.
The bottom floor, Level C, had a small coin-operated laundry room, a larger than normal hotel gym, restrooms, and a meeting space.
We were able to store our luggage for free.
I noticed several different instances of hotel staff displaying rapport with one another, also rare in NYC. This speaks to a positive work environment.
My only suggestion is for the hotel staff to clear a path in the snow for customers who are entering or exiting taxis in front of the hotel. The sidewalk was cleared, but the curb was piled with snow, which was difficult to maneuver.
